title: Launch script Hub integration and obsolete file cleanup

comment: PRE-REVIEW COMPLIANCE ASSESSMENT: COMPLIANT. All 12 required CR sections per SOP-002 Section 6 are present and properly populated. Frontmatter verified: title='Launch script Hub integration and obsolete file cleanup', revision_summary='Initial draft' (acceptable for v0.1). Parent document CR-060 confirmed CLOSED at v2.0. No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME) found in pre-approved sections 1-9. Execution section placeholders are standard EI template markers expected to be populated during execution phase. File lists consistent across Sections 2.3, 5.2, and 7.1. No typos, formatting issues, or section numbering errors found. No TU assignment required - change affects only infrastructure scripts and project documentation, no Flow State application code.

POST-REVIEW COMPLIANCE ASSESSMENT: NON-COMPLIANT. Three deficiencies found during execution verification.

FRONTMATTER VERIFIED:
- title: 'Launch script Hub integration and obsolete file cleanup'
- revision_summary: 'Initial draft' (acceptable for executable document per SOP-002 Section 8)

DOCUMENT STRUCTURE: All 12 required sections per SOP-002 Section 6 are present. No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME) found. Section numbering correct. Formatting consistent.

EXECUTION VERIFICATION - DEFICIENCIES FOUND:

1. INCOMPLETE FIX IN docker/README.md (EI-5 claim inaccurate): EI-5 states 'Fixed stale references discovered in docker/README.md (inbox watcher troubleshooting).' The troubleshooting section (line 319-323) was indeed updated to reference the Agent Hub. However, lines 49 and 54 still contain stale references: Line 49: 'An inbox watcher that monitors all agent inboxes' and Line 54: 'Inbox watcher shows: [QA] New task: Review CR-056'. These describe the old standalone inbox watcher behavior rather than the Agent Hub. The multi-agent session description in docker/README.md was not updated to reflect the Hub integration.

2. INCOMPLETE FIX IN CLAUDE.md (EI-4 claim inaccurate): EI-4 states 'Also fixed start-git_mcp.sh typo to start-git-mcp.sh (matching actual filename).' The directory tree listing at line 230 was correctly updated to show 'start-git-mcp.sh'. However, the command example at line 199 still reads: 'cd docker/scripts && ./start-git_mcp.sh' (underscore instead of hyphen). The actual filename on disk is 'start-git-mcp.sh' (confirmed via filesystem check). The typo fix was only partially applied.

3. STALE COMMENT IN requirements.txt: Line 42 reads 'watchdog>=3.0.0  # Filesystem monitoring for inbox-watcher.py'. The referenced file docker/scripts/inbox-watcher.py was deleted in EI-1. The watchdog dependency may still be needed (the Hub inbox.py uses it), but the comment references a deleted file.

ITEMS VERIFIED AS CORRECT:
- docker/scripts/ contains only mcp_proxy.py, start-mcp-server.sh, start-git-mcp.sh (confirmed)
- All 8 ;C directories deleted (confirmed via find - none remain)
- .inbox-watcher.log deleted (confirmed - file does not exist)
- launch.sh correctly implements ensure_hub() with health check against :9000/api/health (confirmed)
- CLAUDE.md directory tree listing correctly updated (lines 228-231)
- hub.py correctly implements _container_sync_loop (10s polling) and _hub_managed set (confirmed at lines 246-274 and line 28)
- docker/CONTAINER-GUIDE.md no longer references start-container.sh (confirmed)
- docker/README.md troubleshooting section correctly references Agent Hub (lines 319-323)
- No functional references to deleted files in launch.sh (confirmed)
- EI table: 8 EIs, all with Task Outcome of Pass or Fail-then-fix, performed-by and dates recorded
- No VARs required (EI-6 fail addressed by EI-7 fix and EI-8 re-test)

DISPOSITION: The three deficiencies above must be corrected before approval. EI-5 and EI-4 execution summaries should also be updated to accurately reflect what was fixed, or the additional fixes should be noted in execution comments.

POST-REVIEW COMPLIANCE ASSESSMENT (Round 2): COMPLIANT. All three deficiencies from Round 1 have been corrected and verified.

FRONTMATTER VERIFIED:
- title: 'Launch script Hub integration and obsolete file cleanup'
- revision_summary: 'Initial draft' (acceptable for executable document)

FIX VERIFICATION:

1. docker/README.md lines 49/54 FIXED: Line 49 now reads 'The Agent Hub, which monitors all agent inboxes and injects tmux notifications'. Line 54 now reads 'QA terminal shows a tmux notification: [QA] New task: Review CR-056'. Both correctly reference the Agent Hub instead of the old inbox watcher.

2. CLAUDE.md line 199 FIXED: Now reads 'cd docker/scripts && ./start-git-mcp.sh' (hyphen). Matches actual filename on disk (confirmed: docker/scripts/start-git-mcp.sh exists). Consistent with the directory tree listing at line 230.

3. requirements.txt line 42 FIXED: Now reads 'watchdog>=3.0.0  # Filesystem monitoring for Agent Hub inbox watcher'. Comment correctly attributes the dependency to the Hub rather than the deleted inbox-watcher.py.

CR DOCUMENT UPDATES VERIFIED:
- EI-9 added to execution table with description, summary, outcome (Pass), performer (claude), and date (2026-02-07)
- Execution comment added documenting the QA post-review deficiency correction
- Section 11 Execution Summary updated: '9 EIs' (was 8), includes 'QA post-review deficiencies (3 stale references) corrected in EI-9'

COMPLETE POST-REVIEW CHECKLIST:
- All 12 CR sections present per SOP-002 Section 6: PASS
- Frontmatter title and revision_summary present and non-empty: PASS
- No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME): PASS (none found)
- No typos or formatting errors: PASS (none found)
- Section numbering sequential and correct (1-12): PASS
- EI table: 9 EIs, all with outcomes, performers, and dates: PASS
- UAT failure properly documented with fix (EI-7) and re-test (EI-8): PASS
- QA deficiency correction properly documented in EI-9 and execution comments: PASS
- Traceability: CR-060 referenced as parent, SOP-001 and SOP-002 referenced: PASS
- Files on disk match execution claims: PASS (all deletions, modifications, and additions verified)
